io.spine.validate

Class Validate

  • java.lang.Object
    • io.spine.validate.Validate

  • public final class Validate
extends java.lang.Object
    This class provides general validation routines.

        @Deprecated
 @CanIgnoreReturnValue
public static <M extends com.google.protobuf.Message> M checkNotDefault(M object,

        Deprecated. please use Preconditions2.checkNotDefaultArg(Message, Object) or Preconditions2.checkNotDefaultState(Message, Object)
        Ensures that the passed object is not in its default state and is not null.

        errorMessage - the message for the exception to be thrown; will be converted to a string using String.valueOf(Object)

        errorMessageFormat - the format of the error message, which has %s placeholder for the parameter name

      • checkValid

        public static void checkValid(com.google.protobuf.Message message)
                       throws ValidationException
        Validates the given message according to its definition and throws ValidationException if any constraints are violated.
        Throws:
        ValidationException - if the passed message does not satisfy the constraints set for it in its Protobuf definition

      • violationsOf

        public static java.util.List<ConstraintViolation> violationsOf(com.google.protobuf.Message message)
        Validates the given message according to its definition and returns the constrain violations, if any.
        Returns:
        violations of the validation rules or an empty list if the message is valid

      • validateAtRuntime

        @Internal
public static java.util.List<ConstraintViolation> validateAtRuntime(com.google.protobuf.Message message,
                                                                              FieldContext context)
        Validates the given message ignoring the generated validation code.

        Use violationsOf(Message) over this method. It is declared public only to be accessible in the generated code.

        Parameters:
        message - the message to validate
        context - the validation field context
        Returns:
        violations of the validation rules or an empty list if the message is valid

      • violationsOfCustomConstraints

        public static java.util.List<ConstraintViolation> violationsOfCustomConstraints(com.google.protobuf.Message message)
        Validates the given message according to custom validation constraints.

        If there are user-defined ValidatingOptionFactory in the classpath, they are used to create validating options and assemble constraints. If there are no such factories, this method always returns an empty list.

        Parameters:
        message - the message to validate
        Returns:
        a list of violations; an empty list if the message is valid

      • checkValidChange

        public static <M extends com.google.protobuf.Message> void checkValidChange(M previous,
                                                                            M current)
        Checks that when transitioning a message state from previous to current, the set_once constrains are met and throws a ValidationException if the value transition is not valid.
        Type Parameters:
        M - the type of the message
        Parameters:
        previous - the previous state of the message
        current - the new state of the message
        Throws:
        ValidationException - if the value transition is not valid

      • validateChange

        public static <M extends com.google.protobuf.Message> com.google.common.collect.ImmutableSet<ConstraintViolation> validateChange(M previous,
                                                                                                                                 M current)
        Checks that when transitioning a message state from previous to current, the set_once constrains are met.
        Type Parameters:
        M - the type of the message
        Parameters:
        previous - the previous state of the message
        current - the new state of the message
        Returns:
        list of constraint violations, if the transaction is invalid, an empty list otherwise
